user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.14 is: The Standard Library function memcmp shall not be used to compare null terminated strings.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_IdleLoop_Impl:
```c
void OS_IdleLoop_Impl(void)
{
    /*
     * Unblock signals and wait for something to occur
     *
     * Note - "NormalSigMask" was calculated during task init to be the original signal mask
     * of the process PLUS all "RT" signals.  The RT signals are used by timers, so we want
     * to keep them masked here (this is different than the original POSIX impl).  The
     * timebase objects have a dedicated thread that will be doing "sigwait" on those.
     */
    sigsuspend(&POSIX_GlobalVars.NormalSigMask);
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function OS_IdleLoop_Impl:
POSIX_GlobalVars_t POSIX_GlobalVars = {0}
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: I inspected the provided OS_IdleLoop_Impl function and the related symbol definition. The function contains only a call to sigsuspend(&POSIX_GlobalVars.NormalSigMask) and the global POSIX_GlobalVars is initialized with = {0}. There are no uses of memcmp (or any other Standard Library string-comparison functions) in the supplied code fragments, nor any apparent indirect calls or macros that invoke memcmp. Therefore there are no code fragments here that require investigation for violation of MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.14.
